Parameters: byte: the data to be written
Throws: If an I/O error has occurred.
write(byte[]).Description: Writes an array of bytes. This method will block until the bytes are actually written.

Throws: If an I/O error has occurred.
flush().Description: Flushes the stream. This will write any buffered output bytes.

Parameters: byte: the data to be written
int: the start offset in the data
int: the number of bytes that are written
Throws: If an I/O error has occurred.
write(byte[], int, int).Description: Writes a sub array of bytes.
write(byte[], int, int).FullName: public abstract void write (byte[] b, int off, int len)

Parameters: byte: the data to be written
int: the start offset in the data
int: the number of bytes that are written
Throws: If an I/O error has occurred.
write(byte[],int,int).Description: Writes a sub array of bytes.

Throws: If an I/O error has occurred.
close().Description: Closes the stream. This method must be called to release any resources associated with the stream.

Throws: If an I/O error has occurred.
write(int).Description: Writes a byte. This method will block until the byte is actually written.

Parameters: Object: the object to be written
Throws: Any of the usual Input/Output related exceptions.
writeObject(java.lang.Object).Description: Write an object to the underlying storage or stream. The class that implements this interface defines how the object is written.

ClassDesc: ObjectOutput extends the DataOutput interface to include writing of objects. DataOutput includes methods for output of primitive types, ObjectOutput extends that interface to include objects, arrays, and Strings.
